title: I'm Bloomingdale's Fashion Director and Just Got Back From Italy—5 Trends That Will Make Your Wardrobe Chicer
excerpt: Bloomingdale's Fashion Director Marissa Galante Frank shares the five trends she recommends investing in after her trip to Milan, Italy.
text: We may talk a lot about French-girl fashion over here at Who What Wear, but we can't deny that we're enraptured by the personality-driven, elegant, and bold style that Italians do so well. Of course, it's not just us editors who love Italian style. This fall, Bloomingdale's launched its From Italy, With Love campaign—celebrating Italy's enduring influence on style and how it permeates the American landscape and helps set the trends—that spotlights over 150 participating brands, including Moschino and La DoubleJ, and over 300 exclusive products as well as the launch of over 30 brands in store and online.I tapped Bloomingdale's Fashion Director Marissa Galante Frank, who recently came back from Milan Fashion Week and helped curate the From Italy, With Love edit. Below, she dives into the styles and trends she saw on the runways and streets and shares her top products from the Italian brands and designers at Bloomingdale's. Keep scrolling to get inspired.Chocolate Brown(Image credit: Launchmetrics Spotlight)"Chocolate brown was on the color palette of almost every designer in Milan this season. Historically, chocolate is more present during fall collections, but on the spring runways, designers balanced it with candy-coated pastels to create a palette that had fresh contrast on the runway."Shop the trend: Bloomingdale's Cashmere Lined Leather Gloves STAUD Wally Mid Heel Knee High Boots Moschino Tie Me Small Leather Shoulder Bag A Bold Collar Necklace(Image credit: Getty Images)"A collar necklace is an essential part of an Italian woman's jewelry box. It can be styled with everything from an evening gown to a T-shirt, and it will never go out of style, making it a great investment piece. Collars were all over the runway. Gucci reimagined its iconic bamboo hardware into gold, silver, and enamel collars on many of the looks."Shop the trend: AQUA Tubogas Collar Necklace Alberto Amati 14k Yellow Gold Tubogas Collar Necklace AQUA Twisted Pavé Knot Collar Necklace Crivelli 18k Yellow Gold Like Diamond Pavé Choker Necklace Suede(Image credit: Getty Images)"Bohemian style is back, and suede is a key part of the boho DNA. On the runway, it could be found in everything from belts and bags to miniskirts and trench coats. At Prada, a classic brown suede jacket topped off a leopard look. At Fendi, models carried suede bags in a range of colors."Shop the trend: Mansur Gavriel Dream Ballerina Flats Artico Merinillo Shearling Bomber Jacket Bottega Veneta Large Hop Shoulder Bag Embellishment(Image credit: Launchmetrics Spotlight)"Stud, crystal, and beaded details were all over the runway. Prada, Fendi, and Gucci reimagined iconic bags from the past with beading and studs. Marni's finale was an over-the-top crystal-embellished floral dress."Shop the trend: STAUD Tommy Beaded Tomato Shoulder Bag THEMOIRè Olimpia Beads Bag La DoubleJ Ella Velvet Mini Dress Gianvito Rossi Rania 85 Mules Candy-Coated Pastels"Butter yellow, pistachio, cotton-candy pink, and icy blue dominated the runway. What I love about these colors is how chic they work back to the neutrals that you already have in your wardrobe—such as styling it with a khaki trench."Shop the trend: Joshua Sanders Knit Smile Outline Wool Cashmere Blend Beanie Bottega Veneta Small East West Andiamo Shoulder Bag Marco Bicego 18k Yellow Gold Siviglia Multi Stone & Textured Bead Chain Bracelet
html:
We may talk a lot about French-girl fashion over here at Who What Wear, but we can't deny that we're enraptured by the personality-driven, elegant, and bold style that Italians do so well. Of course, it's not just us editors who love Italian style. This fall, Bloomingdale's launched its From Italy, With Love campaign—celebrating Italy's enduring influence on style and how it permeates the American landscape and helps set the trends—that spotlights over 150 participating brands, including Moschino and La DoubleJ, and over 300 exclusive products as well as the launch of over 30 brands in store and online.

I tapped Bloomingdale's Fashion Director Marissa Galante Frank, who recently came back from Milan Fashion Week and helped curate the From Italy, With Love edit. Below, she dives into the styles and trends she saw on the runways and streets and shares her top products from the Italian brands and designers at Bloomingdale's. Keep scrolling to get inspired.

Chocolate Brown

"Chocolate brown was on the color palette of almost every designer in Milan this season. Historically, chocolate is more present during fall collections, but on the spring runways, designers balanced it with candy-coated pastels to create a palette that had fresh contrast on the runway."

Shop the trend:

Bloomingdale's

Cashmere Lined Leather Gloves

STAUD

Wally Mid Heel Knee High Boots

Moschino

Tie Me Small Leather Shoulder Bag

A Bold Collar Necklace

"A collar necklace is an essential part of an Italian woman's jewelry box. It can be styled with everything from an evening gown to a T-shirt, and it will never go out of style, making it a great investment piece. Collars were all over the runway. Gucci reimagined its iconic bamboo hardware into gold, silver, and enamel collars on many of the looks."

Shop the trend:

AQUA

Tubogas Collar Necklace

Alberto Amati

14k Yellow Gold Tubogas Collar Necklace

AQUA

Twisted Pavé Knot Collar Necklace

Crivelli

18k Yellow Gold Like Diamond Pavé Choker Necklace

Suede

"Bohemian style is back, and suede is a key part of the boho DNA. On the runway, it could be found in everything from belts and bags to miniskirts and trench coats. At Prada, a classic brown suede jacket topped off a leopard look. At Fendi, models carried suede bags in a range of colors."

Shop the trend:

Mansur Gavriel

Dream Ballerina Flats

Artico

Merinillo Shearling Bomber Jacket

Bottega Veneta

Large Hop Shoulder Bag

Embellishment

"Stud, crystal, and beaded details were all over the runway. Prada, Fendi, and Gucci reimagined iconic bags from the past with beading and studs. Marni's finale was an over-the-top crystal-embellished floral dress."

Shop the trend:

STAUD

Tommy Beaded Tomato Shoulder Bag

THEMOIRè

Olimpia Beads Bag

La DoubleJ

Ella Velvet Mini Dress

Gianvito Rossi

Rania 85 Mules

Candy-Coated Pastels

"Butter yellow, pistachio, cotton-candy pink, and icy blue dominated the runway. What I love about these colors is how chic they work back to the neutrals that you already have in your wardrobe—such as styling it with a khaki trench."

Shop the trend:

Joshua Sanders

Knit Smile Outline Wool Cashmere Blend Beanie

Bottega Veneta

Small East West Andiamo Shoulder Bag

Marco Bicego

18k Yellow Gold Siviglia Multi Stone & Textured Bead Chain Bracelet
